definition: to sell/to make or carry out (a plan or intrigue etc)
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
to sell/to offer for sale/to put on the market
to retail/to sell individually or in small quantities
advance sale/to sell in advance/to book
to ration merchandise (esp. food in times of shortages)
to dump (selling abroad more cheaply than cost price at home)

sentences.english: Cigarette vending machines could soon be consigned to history.
sentences.chinese: 自動售煙機有可能將很快成爲歷史。

sentences.english: Why not just start with the $100 or $500 lap dance?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼不先從100或500美元的膝舞起售呢？

sentences.english: Abbott has said if elected he would improve relations between Australia and India, including the sale of uranium.
sentences.chinese: 阿博特曾表示，當選後會增進澳印關係，包括售鈾。

sentences.english: The Health Bill proposes to restrict cigarette-vending machines in pubs.
sentences.chinese: 健康法案建議限制酒吧中的自動售煙機。

sentences.english: Goodman will be signing copies of her books following the event.
sentences.chinese: 古德曼將在會議以後籤售她的書。

sentences.english: Microsoft, which previously signed up advertisers via Yahoo Inc.
sentences.chinese: 微軟，以前是通過雅虎來籤售廣告業務的。

sentences.english: Eggs bring a high price today.
Goods of that quality will never sell.
sentences.chinese: 這樣質量的商品絕對售不出去。

sentences.english: How have you handled customers who take advantage of sales support staff?
sentences.chinese: 你如何對待那些起欺瞞銷售輔助售人員的顧客？

sentences.english: But thestate dept will say the sale violates national security of the U. S.
sentences.chinese: 但是國務院會說出售侵犯了美國的國家安全。

sentences.english: Old total site signed sale, with your unexpected benefits.
sentences.chinese: 老總現場籤售，有您意想不到的實惠。

sentences.english: I say sell out, andI sayithas a condescension toit.
sentences.chinese: 我說出售，對它而言還是一種屈尊。

sentences.english: The fund raising period shall be calculated starting from the day of offering the fund shares.
sentences.chinese: 基金募集期限自基金份額髮售之日起計算。

sentences.english: At this point, all sung in sea conditions limited the sale of the shares have been lifted.
sentences.chinese: 至此，中海海盛所有有限售條件股份均已解禁。

sentences.english: An item's value generally depreciates when it is sold back to jewellers.
sentences.chinese: 金首飾售回給珠寶商時通常收不回原價。

sentences.english: The coffee machine also sells cold drinks .

definition: to hit the market (of a new product)/to float (a company on the stock market)
to cut prices/to discount/to mark down/price cutting
to ration merchandise (esp. food in times of shortages)
to sell/to sell on commission/to distribute
